abstract: The Federal Communications Commission said it would resume its review of AT&T’s $39 billion bid for T-Mobile USA after AT&T provided more information about new economic models used to justify the deal.
snippet: The Federal Communications Commission said it would resume its review of AT&T’s $39 billion bid for T-Mobile USA after AT&T provided more information about new economic models used to justify the deal.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Communications Commission said on Friday that it had restarted its review of AT&T‘s proposed $39 billion takeover of T-Mobile USA, after pausing the process to demand more information about the deal.

headline.main: F.C.C. Restarts Clock on Review of AT&T’s T-Mobile Deal

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
